Can you send me all the parameters?

Sure! Here are the parameters you can use for integrating NewsBreak as a traffic source in Keitaro:
1. `{externalid}`: Click ID
2. `{conversionid}`: Conversion ID
3. `{amount}`: Conversion amount
4. `{eventtype}`: Event type
5. `{campaignid}`: Campaign ID
6. `{adsetid}`: Ad Set ID
7. `{adid}`: Ad ID
8. `{creativeid}`: Creative ID
9. `{placement}`: Placement
10. `{siteid}`: Site ID
11. `{publisherid}`: Publisher ID
12. `{sub1}`, `{sub2}`, etc.: Custom Sub IDs (for additional tracking parameters)
13. `{timestamp}`: Timestamp of the click or conversion event.
14. `{useragent}`: User Agent of the click or conversion event.
15. `{ipaddress}`: IP Address of the click or conversion event.
16. `{countrycode}`: Country Code of the user.
17. `{deviceidfa}`,`{devicegaid}`,`{devicetype}`,`{osversion}`,`{browsername}`,`{browserversion}`, ` {language} ` : Device and browser information.
18.` {transaction_id} ` : Transaction identifier for tracking purposes.
19.` {currency} ` : Currency code for monetary values.
20.` {revenue} ` : Revenue generated from the conversion event.
21.` {cost} ` : Cost associated with the click or conversion event.
22.` {profit} ` : Profit calculated from revenue minus cost.
23.` {click_url} ` : URL where the user clicked on your ad.
24.` {referrer_url} ` : Referring URL that led to the click or conversion event.
25.` {session_id} ` : Session identifier for tracking user sessions across multiple events.

The user has uploaded an image of a user interface for creating a source, featuring parameters such as Name, Traffic loss, and various fields for keywords, cost, currency, and IDs.

To set up NewsBreak as a traffic source in Keitaro, you can follow these steps to place the parameters correctly in the template:
1. **Traffic Source Name**: Set it to 'NewsBreak'.
2. **Postback URL**: Use the following format for your postback URL:
```
https://yourdomain.com/postback?clickid={externalid}&conversionid={conversionid}&amount={amount}&eventtype={eventtype}
```
3. **Parameters**: Map the parameters as follows:
   - Click ID: `{externalid}`
   - Conversion ID: `{conversionid}`
   - Amount: `{amount}`
   - Event Type: `{eventtype}`
4. **Additional Parameters** (if needed): You can add more parameters based on your tracking requirements, such as:
   - Campaign ID: `{campaignid}`
   - Ad Set ID: `{adsetid}`
   - Ad ID: `{adid}`
   - Creative ID: `{creativeid}`
   - Placement: `{placement}`
   - Site ID: `{siteid}`
   - Publisher ID: `{publisherid}`
5. **Save the Template**.
Make sure to replace `yourdomain.com` with your actual domain where Keitaro is hosted.
If you need further assistance or run into any issues, feel free to ask!

What postback link should I use?

To set up the postback link for NewsBreak in Keitaro, you can use the following format:
```
https://yourdomain.com/postback?clickid={externalid}&conversionid={conversionid}&amount={amount}&eventtype={eventtype}
```
Make sure to replace `yourdomain.com` with your actual domain where Keitaro is hosted. This link will pass the necessary parameters from NewsBreak to Keitaro for tracking conversions.
If you need more detailed instructions, please refer to our generic postback integration guide here: [Generic Postback Integration Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/24825901083277-How-to-set-up-a-Voluum-Postback-on-NewsBreak). Let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance!
Is this s2s?

Yes, the postback link setup is an example of server-to-server (S2S) tracking. This method allows you to track conversions by sending data directly from NewsBreak's server to Keitaro's server, ensuring accurate and reliable tracking without relying on browser-based methods.
If you need more detailed instructions or have any other questions, please refer to our generic postback integration guide here: [Generic Postback Integration Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/24825901083277-How-to-set-up-a-Voluum-Postback-on-NewsBreak).

Make sure to replace `yourdomain.com` with your actual domain where Keitaro is hosted. This link will pass the necessary parameters from NewsBreak to Keitaro for tracking conversions.

Is this s2s postback correct? What I want is to run ads from newsbreak and pass the traffic to my keitaro campaign link

Got it! To run ads from NewsBreak and pass the traffic to your Keitaro campaign link, you need to set up the S2S postback correctly. Here’s how you can do it:
1. **Traffic Source Setup in Keitaro**:
   - **Name**: Enter 'NewsBreak'.
   - **Postback URL**: Use the following format for your postback URL:
```
https://yourdomain.com/postback?clickid={externalid}&conversionid={conversionid}&amount={amount}&eventtype={eventtype}
```
   - Replace `yourdomain.com` with your actual domain where Keitaro is hosted.
2. **Campaign Link in NewsBreak**:
   - Use your Keitaro campaign link as the destination URL for your ads in NewsBreak.
3. **Parameters and Placeholders**:
   - Click ID: `{externalid}`
   - Conversion ID: `{conversionid}`
   - Amount: `{amount}`
   - Event Type: `{eventtype}`
4. **Example Postback URL**:
```
https://yourdomain.com/postback?clickid={externalid}&conversionid={conversionid}&amount={amount}&eventtype={eventtype}
```
This setup will ensure that when a user clicks on your ad from NewsBreak, they are directed to your Keitaro campaign link, and conversions are tracked accurately using the S2S postback method.
If you need more detailed instructions or have any other questions, please refer to our generic postback integration guide here: [Generic Postback Integration Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/24825901083277-How-to-set-up-a-Voluum-Postback-on-NewsBreak).
Now I want to add pixel on it to track the events

Sure! To add a NewsBreak pixel to track events, you can follow these steps:
1. **Create a Pixel in NewsBreak**:
   - Log in to your NewsBreak account and navigate to the Pixel section.
   - Create a new pixel and copy the pixel code provided.
2. **Add the Pixel Code to Your Keitaro Campaign**:
   - Go to your Keitaro campaign settings and find the section where you can add custom scripts or pixels.
   - Paste the NewsBreak pixel code into this section.
3. **Track Events**:
   - Ensure that the pixel is set up to track specific events such as page views, clicks, conversions, etc.
4. **Verify Integration**:
   - Test the integration by performing actions on your campaign link and checking if the events are being tracked correctly in NewsBreak.
For detailed instructions on how to install a NewsBreak Pixel with GTM (Google Tag Manager), you can refer to this guide: [How to install a NewsBreak Pixel with GTM](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/24825901083277-How-to-set-up-a-Voluum-Postback-on-NewsBreak). What is the traffic source postback url for volumm

To set up the traffic source postback URL for Voluum with NewsBreak, you can follow these steps:
1. **Traffic Source Setup in Voluum**:
   - Go to the Traffic Sources tab and create a new traffic source or edit an existing one.
   - Add the following postback URL in the Traffic Source element:
```
https://yourdomain.com/postback?clickid={externalid}&conversionid={conversionid}&amount={amount}&eventtype={eventtype}
```
   - Replace `yourdomain.com` with your actual domain where Voluum is hosted.
2. **Parameters and Placeholders**:
   - Click ID: `{externalid}`
   - Conversion ID: `{conversionid}`
   - Amount: `{amount}`
   - Event Type: `{eventtype}`
3. **Testing the Integration**:
   - You can test your Traffic Source postback URL directly in NewsBreak Event Manager by performing a test conversion that will be recorded in Voluum.
For detailed instructions, please refer to our guide on setting up a Voluum postback on NewsBreak here: [How to set up a Voluum Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/24825901083277-How-to-set-up-a-Voluum-Postback-on-NewsBreak). This conversion event code where do I place it?

<!-- Track conversion event, please use EXACT 'event', 'complete_registration' in the code below -->
  <script>
    nbpix('event','complete_registration', {nb_value: xxx});
  </script>

You should place the conversion event code within the HTML of your landing page or thank you page where the conversion event occurs. Here’s how you can do it:
1. **Landing Page or Thank You Page**:
   - Locate the section of your HTML where you want to track the conversion event (e.g., after a user completes a registration).
2. **Insert Conversion Event Code**:
   - Add the following script within the `<head>` or `<body>` tags of your HTML file:
```
<!-- Track conversion event, please use EXACT 'event', 'complete_registration' in the code below -->
<script>
  nbpix('event','complete_registration', {nb_value: xxx});
</script>
```
3. **Replace `xxx` with Actual Value**:
   - Replace `xxx` with the actual value you want to pass back (e.g., registration ID, amount, etc.).
4. **Save and Test**:
   - Save your changes and test to ensure that conversions are being tracked correctly.
For more detailed instructions on setting up NewsBreak Pixel events, please refer to this guide: [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA). Let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance!

```
<!-- Track conversion event, please use EXACT 'event', 'complete_registration' in the code below -->
<script>
  nbpix('event','complete_registration', {nb_value: xxx});
</script>
```
2. **Check for JavaScript Errors**:
   - Open your browser's developer tools (usually by pressing F12) and check for any JavaScript errors in the console that might be preventing the script from running.
3. **Network Requests**:
   - In the developer tools, go to the Network tab and look for any requests being made to NewsBreak's tracking URL when you perform a test conversion.
4. **Correct Parameters**:
   - Ensure that all parameters (`clickid`, `conversionid`, `amount`, `eventtype`) are correctly passed and match what is expected by NewsBreak.
5. **Test with Different Browsers**:
   - Sometimes browser-specific issues can cause problems. Test your setup in different browsers to see if it works elsewhere.
6. **Contact Support**:
   - If you have followed all these steps and still face issues, please contact our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your setup and any error messages you see.
For more detailed instructions on setting up NewsBreak Pixel events, please refer to this guide: [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA). Let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance!
What if I only have the landing page and the conversions event will happen on other page

If the conversion event happens on a different page than the landing page, you need to place the conversion tracking code on that specific page where the conversion occurs. Here’s how you can do it:
1. **Identify the Conversion Page**:
   - Determine which page the user will be redirected to after completing the desired action (e.g., a thank you page or confirmation page).
2. **Insert Conversion Event Code**:
   - Add the following script within the `<head>` or `<body>` tags of your HTML file on the conversion page:
```
<!-- Track conversion event, please use EXACT 'event', 'complete_registration' in the code below -->
<script>
  nbpix('event','complete_registration', {nb_value: xxx});
</script>
```
3. **Replace `xxx` with Actual Value**:
   - Replace `xxx` with the actual value you want to pass back (e.g., registration ID, amount, etc.).
4. **Save and Test**:
   - Save your changes and test to ensure that conversions are being tracked correctly.
5. **Verify Script Placement and Functionality**:
   - Ensure that there are no JavaScript errors and that network requests are being made correctly when a user lands on this conversion page.
For more detailed instructions on setting up NewsBreak Pixel events, please refer to this guide: [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA). Let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance!
